title: Thunderbird not saving all Recent Destinations
creator: blkalish
content: I recently updated Thunderbird to Nebula v139.0 and now my "Recent Destinations" list is not saving all my folders in its list after moving / copying emails to the destination folder I selected. It seems that the "Recent Destinations" list is only saving (or maybe just displaying) folders with names beginning with "A" - "N". If I move an email to a folder with its name beginning with "O" - "Z", the email will be moved to the appropriate / selected folder, but the folder (destination) name will NOT appear in the "Recent Destinations" list.

title: No me entran los correos nuevos
creator: alfonsolor
content:
Buen día. Después de muchos años usando thunderbird, llevo con el 20 años o más, es la primera vez que me da problemas. Os pongo en antecedentes. Actualmente manejo con thunderbird 6 cuentas de correo, y hasta hace dos años llevaba 9 (de 3 servidores distintos), y nunca he tenido problemas.

Hasta hace 15 díás, más concretamente hasta el 19/05/2025. Una de las cuentas de gmail, dejo de recibir correos, y cuando le das a recibir siempre sale "no hay mensajes nuevos" siendo esto, claro está incorrecto porque si accedo a la misma a través de web (o el móvil), si que tengo muchos correos sin leer. Enviar, sigo enviando correos por la cuenta sin problemas, y comparando la configuración con las otras cuentas que si que funcionan, no hay nada diferente, y que yo sepa en la cuenta de gmail no he tocado nada, ya que hasta el 20/5/25 he manejado los correos con thunderbird. Dar por confirmado que en gmail, tengo activada la opción de programas "menos seguros", ya manejaba la cuenta antes de que gmail incorporara la autentificación por OAuth2, y la he manadado con dicha autenticación mucho tiempo después. Os mando la configuración de la cuenta y el programa está corriendo sobre Linux - Debian, desde que comencé a manejarlo.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo, y espero vuestras ideas de porque pasa que de repente deja de "ver" los correos entrantes.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/128.0;kb_visits_prior:["/es/kb/thunderbird-y-gmail"]

title: Windows Thunderbird 139.0 (64-bit): Embed Link fails with advanced options (bug1969767)
creator: Rehtael
content:
The 13x version appears to have introduced a bug.

When pasting links into emails, and then "inserting" the link, if you try to add any advanced options to the link (i.e. target=_blank), it doesn't create the link.

If you simply "insert" the link without setting any advanced options, then the link is created.

title: Reinstalling Thunderbird
creator: rharder122
content:
This is in response to Wayne who asked for this info..... unfortunately he only left me with a "no reply" email address.

Wayne, I followed the instructions on how to save Thunderbird info to be reinstalled after the new installations Windows 11. I stored it on a memory 512gb card. I downloaded a new copy of Thunderbird and noticed that once it was installed and I opened it I have to enter my primary password and then this page opens up. I enter all the name, email address and password..... Just as a side note, I keep a record of all my passwords but could not find one for Thunderbird. I did have one for Firefox and it accepted that password. I clicked on continue and this is what comes up next.

I then click on done and it again starts looking for a password. After 4 or 5 minutes I get a yellow box with the following in it. I have tired to uninstall Thunderbird and then download and reinstall it. Go back to what I had save earlier and follow the instruction of not opening Thunderbird, bring up the app/roaming box and copy and pasting the backup I made a few days before. This file was labeled "Thunderbird_Backup_Profile". I copied and pasted following the instructions....nothing..... I tried opening the folder and copied and pasted that to the app/roaming folder.... nothing...The file in the backup folder was labeled "0boaz5ty default release". So I don't know where to go from here...... Ray

title: Thunderbird Can't Receive Mail with Connection Security set to SSL/TLS
creator: blugene
content:
I have spent some time digging through your messages about how to fix this issue. I get the general "where to" enable SSL/TLS but no trouble shooting to this specific level.

Spectrum (charter) Internet on May-30-25 a pop up "Add Security Exception" on wife's account (Image #1 below). We have same Internet provider and same server config's (except email name & password or course). 

 This Security Exception has happened before, as well as on my account in the past.

Although, I never got the Exception this time. We did "Confirm Security Exception" 2x on her account and she is up and running again. No issues. 

  However, I can't receive e-mails with the Account Settings / Server Settings / Security Settings

"Connection Security" set to SSL/TLS" it must be set to "None" When set to SSL/TLS and I push the "Get Mail" button, the server isn't even banged as there's no msg in lower left frame of TB. I have gmail account and it does bang that one like it should. If set to "None" I get the msg in lower left TB frame showing connection to Charter server and I receive any outstanding e-mails. But I don't want to continue without a password. 

 Under [Settings/ Privacy & security / Manage Certificates]

hers (Image #2 below) looks different than mine (Image #3 below). She has the 2 confirmed Security Exceptions, but also has a "View" and "Export" button that are bolded when the specific line item is highlighted. I do not have a View or Export button shown. How do I enable the SSL/TLS with password and actually receive emails? 

 I am using TB 128.11.0esr (64-bit)

thx in advance Gene
metadata: ;solver_id:1336989;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:136.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/136.0

title: Thunderbird Flatpak remains on ESR instead of Release Channel (ESR128toRelease)
creator: schinkentoast
content:
Hi there,

I'm using Thunderbird on Linux and would like to know if there is a timeline for when the official Flatpak will be switched from ESR to Release Channel. There was a mention in an article on the Thunderbird blog (https://blog.thunderbird.net/2025/03/thunderbird-release-channel-update/) about the release version being available as Flatpak "in the future" but since this was almost three months ago, I was wondering if there is an update regarding this.

I'm aware that I can either install Thunderbird manually or use the beta Flatpak (which already seems to be on release channel) but I would much prefer to use the stable Flatpak.

Thanks!
